description: From Arabic كُحْل‎ (kuḥl, “antimony; kohl, stibnite (powdered antimony)”). Doublet of alcohol and alcool.

entries.meaning: A dark powder (usually powdered antimony) used as eye makeup, especially in Eastern countries; stibnite.

verbs.description: kohl (third-person singular simple present kohls, present participle kohling, simple past and past participle kohled)

entries.meaning: To decorate one's eyes with kohl.
